00071 char lnet_upcall[1024] = "/usr/lib/lustre/lnet_upcall";
00072 char lnet_debug_log_upcall[1024] = "/usr/lib/lustre/lnet_debug_log_upcall";
00073 
00079 void libcfs_run_debug_log_upcall(char *file)
00080 {
00081         char *argv[3];
00082         int   rc;
00083         char *envp[] = {
00084                 "HOME=/",
00085                 "PATH=/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin",
00086                 NULL};
00087         ENTRY;
00088 
00089         argv[0] = lnet_debug_log_upcall;
00090 
00091         LASSERTF(file != NULL, "called on a null filename\n");
00092         argv[1] = file; //only need to pass the path of the file
00093 
00094         argv[2] = NULL;
00095 
00096         rc = call_usermodehelper(argv[0], argv, envp, 1);
00097         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENOENT) {
00098                 CERROR("Error %d invoking LNET debug log upcall %s %s; "
00099                        "check /proc/sys/lnet/debug_log_upcall\n",
00100                        rc, argv[0], argv[1]);
00101         } else {
00102                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "Invoked LNET debug log upcall %s %s\n",
00103                        argv[0], argv[1]);
00104         }
00105 
00106         EXIT;
00107 }
00108 
00109 void libcfs_run_upcall(char **argv)
00110 {
00111         int   rc;
00112         int   argc;
00113         char *envp[] = {
00114                 "HOME=/",
00115                 "PATH=/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin",
00116                 NULL};
00117         ENTRY;
00118 
00119         argv[0] = lnet_upcall;
00120         argc = 1;
00121         while (argv[argc] != NULL)
00122                 argc++;
00123 
00124         LASSERT(argc >= 2);
00125 
00126         rc = call_usermodehelper(argv[0], argv, envp, 1);
00127         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENOENT) {
00128                 CERROR("Error %d invoking LNET upcall %s %s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s; "
00129                        "check /proc/sys/lnet/upcall\n",
00130                        rc, argv[0], argv[1],
00131                        argc < 3 ? "" : ",", argc < 3 ? "" : argv[2],
00132                        argc < 4 ? "" : ",", argc < 4 ? "" : argv[3],
00133                        argc < 5 ? "" : ",", argc < 5 ? "" : argv[4],
00134                        argc < 6 ? "" : ",...");
00135         } else {
00136                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "Invoked LNET upcall %s %s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s\n",
00137                        argv[0], argv[1],
00138                        argc < 3 ? "" : ",", argc < 3 ? "" : argv[2],
00139                        argc < 4 ? "" : ",", argc < 4 ? "" : argv[3],
00140                        argc < 5 ? "" : ",", argc < 5 ? "" : argv[4],
00141                        argc < 6 ? "" : ",...");
00142         }
00143 }
00144 
00145 void libcfs_run_lbug_upcall(struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata)
00146 {
00147         char *argv[6];
00148         char buf[32];
00149 
00150         ENTRY;
00151         snprintf (buf, sizeof buf, "%d", msgdata->msg_line);
00152 
00153         argv[1] = "LBUG";
00154         argv[2] = (char *)msgdata->msg_file;
00155         argv[3] = (char *)msgdata->msg_fn;
00156         argv[4] = buf;
00157         argv[5] = NULL;
00158 
00159         libcfs_run_upcall (argv);
00160 }
00161 EXPORT_SYMBOL(libcfs_run_lbug_upcall);
00162 
00163 /* coverity[+kill] */
00164 void lbug_with_loc(struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata)
00165 {
00166         libcfs_catastrophe = 1;
00167         libcfs_debug_msg(msgdata, "LBUG\n");
00168 
00169         if (in_interrupt()) {
00170                 panic("LBUG in interrupt.\n");
00171                 /* not reached */
00172         }
00173 
00174         libcfs_debug_dumpstack(NULL);
00175         if (!libcfs_panic_on_lbug)
00176                 libcfs_debug_dumplog();
00177         libcfs_run_lbug_upcall(msgdata);
00178         if (libcfs_panic_on_lbug)
00179                 panic("LBUG");
00180         set_task_state(current, TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00181         while (1)
00182                 schedule();
00183 }
00184 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lbug_with_loc);

00186 #ifdef CONFIG_X86
00187 #include <linux/nmi.h>
00188 #include <asm/stacktrace.h>
00189 
00190 #ifdef HAVE_STACKTRACE_WARNING
00191 static void
00192 print_trace_warning_symbol(void *data, char *msg, unsigned long symbol)
00193 {
00194         printk("%s", (char *)data);
00195         print_symbol(msg, symbol);
00196         printk("\n");
00197 }
00198 
00199 static void print_trace_warning(void *data, char *msg)
00200 {
00201         printk("%s%s\n", (char *)data, msg);
00202 }
00203 #endif
00204 
00205 static int print_trace_stack(void *data, char *name)
00206 {
00207         printk(" <%s> ", name);
00208         return 0;
00209 }
00210 
00211 static void print_trace_address(void *data, unsigned long addr, int reliable)
00212 {
00213         char fmt[32];
00214 
00215         touch_nmi_watchdog();
00216         sprintf(fmt, " [<%016lx>] %s%%s\n", addr, reliable ? "": "? ");
00217         __print_symbol(fmt, addr);
00218 }
00219 
00220 static const struct stacktrace_ops print_trace_ops = {
00221 #ifdef HAVE_STACKTRACE_WARNING
00222         .warning = print_trace_warning,
00223         .warning_symbol = print_trace_warning_symbol,
00224 #endif
00225         .stack = print_trace_stack,
00226         .address = print_trace_address,
00227 #ifdef STACKTRACE_OPS_HAVE_WALK_STACK
00228         .walk_stack = print_context_stack,
00229 #endif
00230 };
00231 
00232 static void libcfs_call_trace(struct task_struct *tsk)
00233 {
00234         dump_trace(tsk, NULL, NULL,
00235 #ifdef HAVE_DUMP_TRACE_ADDRESS
00236                    0,
00237 #endif /* HAVE_DUMP_TRACE_ADDRESS */
00238                    &print_trace_ops, NULL);
00239         printk("\n");
00240 }
00241 
00242 #else /* !CONFIG_X86 */
00243 
00244 static void libcfs_call_trace(struct task_struct *tsk)
00245 {
00246         if ((tsk == NULL) || (tsk == current))
00247                 dump_stack();
00248         else
00249                 CWARN("can't show stack: kernel doesn't export show_task\n");
00250 }
00251 
00252 #endif /* CONFIG_X86 */
00253 
00254 void libcfs_debug_dumpstack(struct task_struct *tsk)
00255 {
00256         /* dump_stack() */
00257         /* show_trace() */
00258         if (tsk == NULL)
00259                 tsk = current;
00260         printk("Pid: %d, comm: %.20s\n", tsk->pid, tsk->comm);
00261         /* show_trace_log_lvl() */
00262         printk("\nCall Trace:\n");
00263         libcfs_call_trace(tsk);
00264 }
00265 EXPORT_SYMBOL(libcfs_debug_dumpstack);
00266 
00267 struct task_struct *libcfs_current(void)
00268 {
00269         CWARN("current task struct is %p\n", current);
00270         return current;
00271 }
00272 
00273 static int panic_notifier(struct notifier_block *self, unsigned long unused1,
00274                          void *unused2)
00275 {
00276         if (libcfs_panic_in_progress)
00277                 return 0;
00278 
00279         libcfs_panic_in_progress = 1;
00280         mb();
00281 
00282 #ifdef LNET_DUMP_ON_PANIC
00283         /* This is currently disabled because it spews far too much to the
00284          * console on the rare cases it is ever triggered. */
00285 
00286         if (in_interrupt()) {
00287                 cfs_trace_debug_print();
00288         } else {
00289 #ifdef HAVE_KERNEL_LOCKED
00290                 while (kernel_locked())
00291                         unlock_kernel();
00292 #endif
00293                 libcfs_debug_dumplog_internal((void *)(long)current_pid());
00294         }
00295 #endif
00296         return 0;
00297 }
00298 
00299 static struct notifier_block libcfs_panic_notifier = {
00300         notifier_call :     panic_notifier,
00301         next :              NULL,
00302         priority :          10000
00303 };
00304 
00305 void libcfs_register_panic_notifier(void)
00306 {
00307         atomic_notifier_chain_register(&panic_notifier_list, &libcfs_panic_notifier);
00308 }
00309 
00310 void libcfs_unregister_panic_notifier(void)
00311 {
00312         atomic_notifier_chain_unregister(&panic_notifier_list, &libcfs_panic_notifier);
00313 }
